Detailed Description

Class Graphics. Low level graphic functions + some game specific stuff.

If a drawing function takes a Coordinates object as a reference, the object is considered to be a part of the continuous world and it may appear in up tp four different places on the screen and it is subject to scrolling. If a function takes x and y coordinates, the object is drawn on those screen coordinates and it is not scrolled.

Common game graphics is loaded on init. Sprite indexes are defined in images.h. Files are defined in resource file data/bitmpas.

Only on graphics object may exist. It sould be created when the program starts and deleted before just before it quits.

Author:
Tapio Auvinen

void Graphics::clear (   ) 
 

Clears backbuffer.

void Graphics::createStarfield (   ) 
 

Creates a random starfield. The field is stored in Graphics until a new one is created.

SDL_Surface * Graphics::createSurface (  unsigned int  w,
unsigned int  h
) 
 

Creates a unique surface that can be used to store any image data. The surface must be freed when it's not needed anymore.

Parameters:
w width in pixels
h height in pixels
Returns:
pointer to the new surface, NULL on failure

void Graphics::drawAnimated (  int  spriteIndex,
const Coordinates &  location,
float  phase
) 
 

Draws a sprite on the screen. Selects frame accoring to phase. 0 = first frame, .999 = last frame, 1 = first frame again... Phase can be between (0, inf). This if useful for loopable animations. For non-loopable animations make sure not to ever reach 'phase = 1' because that's the first frame again.

Parameters:
spriteIndex indexes are defined in images.h
&location Location of the center, world coordinates
phase Phase of animation, [0, 1] or [0, inf] (looping)

int  x,
int  y,
SDL_Rect *  sourceRect = NULL
) 
 

Draws a bitmap on the screen. Absolute screen coordinates.

Parameters:
*surface Surface to be copied on the screen
x Location of the center, screen coordinates
y Location of the center, screen coordinates
*sourceRect Defines the area of the source bitmap that is to be copied. NULL means that whole bitmap is copied.

const Coordinates &  location,
SDL_Rect *  sourceRect = NULL

Parameters:
*surface Surface to be copied on the screen
&location Location of the center of the object, world coordinates
*sourceRect Defines the area of the source bitmap that is to be copied. NULL means that whole bitmap is copied.

void Graphics::drawRotated (  const SDL_Surface *  source,
SDL_Surface *  target,
float  angle
) 
 

Rotates a bitmap and draws the result on a surface. Note that this is a rather slow operation.

Parameters:
*source Bitmap to be rotated.
*target Surface that the result is drawn to
rot angle in radians, 0 = east, ccw

int Graphics::getSpriteIndex (  char *  name  ) 
 

Returns a sprite index. This index can be used later to access the sprite.

Parameters:
*name Name of the sprite. Names are defined in resource file 'data/bitmaps'.
Returns:
sprite index, or -1 if there is no such sprite

const SDL_Surface * Graphics::getSurface (  int  spriteIndex  ) 
 

Returns the sdl-surface of a sprite. Note that many objects may use the same sprite and sprites may not be modified.

Parameters:
spriteIndex indexes are defined in images.h
Returns:
NULL if there is no such sprite

int  y
) 
 

Converts screen coordinates to world coordinates.

Parameters:
x x location on screen
y y location on screen
Returns:
Coordinates object. Remember to delete it afterwards.

bool Graphics::init (  int  resX,
int  resY,
int  bitDepth
) 
 

Initializes the graphics engine. Nothing must be drawn before this is done. If this fails, you should quit.

Parameters:
resX x-resolution
resY y-resolution
resX bit depth in bits usually 16, 24 or 32
Returns:
true if successful.

SDL_Surface * Graphics::loadBitmap (  char *  fileName  ) 
 

Loads a bitmap and returns a pointer to the sdl-surface. Remember to free it.

Parameters:
fileName file name
Returns:
pointer to the surface, NULL on failure

void Graphics::lock (   ) 
 

Locks the screen to allow direct access. This is not necessary for normal sprite blitting.

void Graphics::moveCamera (  float  x,
float  y
) 
 

Scrolls viewport by (x, y). Relative coordinates, world units.

Parameters:
x distance to be scrolled
y distance to be scrolled

void Graphics::setCamera (  float  x,
float  y
) 
 

Moves camera so that point (x, y) is centerd. Absolute coordintes, world units.

Parameters:
x new x coordinate, world units
y new y coordinate, world units

void Graphics::setCoordinateSystem (  const CoordinateSystem &  system  ) 
 

Sets coordinate system so that grapchics becomes aware of the dimensions of the world. This must be set before any game graphics is drawn.

Parameters:
&system new coordinate system

void Graphics::unlock (   ) 
 

Unlocks the screen if it was locked with lock().

void Graphics::update (   ) 
 

Updates screen so that user can see changes.
